headline: Fra Diavolo Sauce With Pasta
description: Diavolo sauce is a spicy, garlicky, tomato Italian pasta sauce that's delicious with shellfish; serve over hot linguine for a restaurant-worthy meal.

video.description: Watch how to make a nice and spicy shrimp and scallop pasta in this video.
video.name: Fra Diavolo Sauce With Pasta

name: Fra Diavolo Sauce With Pasta
recipeIngredient: 3 cups whole peeled tomatoes with liquid, chopped
8 ounces small shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil and garlic in a large saucepan over medium heat. When garlic starts to sizzle, pour in tomatoes and season with salt and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil, then simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente; drain.

Heat remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over high heat; add shrimp and scallops. Cook, stirring frequently, until the shrimp turn pink, about 2 minutes Add shrimp and scallops to tomato mixture and stir in parsley. Cook until sauce just begins to bubble, about 3 to 4 minutes. Serve sauce over pasta.

review.reviewBody: We loved it! I added fresh basil and onion. Easy dish but delicious!
It was okay, kinda bland, and i added basil.
Only change I made was skipping the scallops & doubled the shrimp...not a scallop fan. Delicious recipe, will definitely make again. Thanks for sharing!
Loved this!! I added mushrooms and onions. Delicious!!
One of the easiest recipes to date. Very happy with overall taste. I would suggest spicing up shrimp when pan frying. I will be adding garlic to pan.
easy to make, lots of flavor.
Simple yet very favourable.
I made this recipe and added 1/2 teaspoon of Old Bay seasoning to the tomato sauce. We loved it!
Great and easy dish...Quick and nice presentation! Buen appetite!!:)
I did scale it down to 2 servings. The garlic was a little over powering, I will just cut about 1/3 of the garlic next time but overall it was a very good dish.

This is a good base recipe, and I used it to build what I was looking for. Added chopped onion, basil and oregano, zucchini and peppers, and a splash of red wine (I used the cooking wine as we rarely drink). Omitted salt as there is lots in the tomato products. I used canned Marzano type and some red pepper stewed tomatoes as fresh is pretty expensive where I live. A definite great choice for the menu rotation!

This was another fabulous pasta dish. I did use medium shrimp since I couldn't find any small shrimp. I didn't see red pepper flakes mentioned in the directions, so I skipped it. Why is it listed there? I also use one skillet to cook the sauce and the seafood. I also passed on the parsley too. I would make it again.

Made this for a birthday dinner and used shrimp & scallops. It was very good but deducted 2 stars because the measurement on the hot pepper flakes was so high in the written recipe. We love spicy and I only used 1/4 tsp. which was more than enough, anymore and the spice would have overwhelmed the delicate flavors of the seafood. Thank you for sharing your recipe....
Made like recipe. Next time fresh tomatoes probably.

Excellent! It was easy to do and made a great Friday night meal. It had a bit of kick, but not too much and was incredibly flavorful. My husband isnt one to rave about seafood and pasta but he loved this!
Easy to prepare. Restaurant quality.
Yum!
I used the recipe as written. The taste was like a great cioppino!

Tried this recipe for my husband. He fell in love with this dish at an Italian restaurant we used to frequently visit years ago. He says it tastes just as good as he remembers. Only change I would make is I might add just a pinch more red pepper to give a little more heat. Great recipe and it was very easy!

1. Double the garlic
2. Use about 1 additional cup of the canned SM tomatoes (whole peeled tomatoes that I chop). Can use two of the smaller cans.
3. I use 1-1.5 pounds of scallops and 2/3 pound of shrimp. 
4. Top with Pecorino Romano cheese.
5. Amazing

I’ll give 5 stars with my adjustments. I used 3 cups fresh peeled Roma tomatoes. I started with the garlic and also added cup of mushrooms. Cook that down a little then add tomatoes and I used a small can of tomato paste. Once that cooks a few minutes I added about 1/2 cup white wine and crushed red peppers. We love spice so I added 3 tsp of red peppers, we want our tongue to burn! I let that cook down for about 20-30 mins. I started the pasta and dried out the shrimp with paper towels. Once most of the water was gone from the shrimp, I seasoned the shrimp with cayenne pepper and salt. I added the shrimp to the sauce and allowed to cook. Once the pasta had cooked for 5 mins, I added a splash of heavy cream and oregano to the sauce. I let that cook down until pasta was done and added the parsley. It was spicy and delicious!
Excellent!! I had to leave out the scallops because my husband is allergic to them, but this is a 5-star dish even with just shrimp. I will definitely be making this again and again.
Although I did not eat this, due to an inability to eat spicy food, my family and a friend raved about how good it is was. I used a large can of diced tomatoes to save time!
This dinner was really delicious and easy to prepare. Loved it!
We really loved this! I made it GF pasta, & added a can of clams, with just a touch of the juice, it was fantastic!
I've been looking for a flavorful pasta sauce without having to add meat. This is it. I need low sodium recipes, so cut salt in half and family tastes dictate less red pepper

I wish I had read the comments before making this!
I usually enjoy a good kick but I followed the recipe to a T and it was way too spicy for me. 
Next time, I'll cut back on the crushed red pepper and try a little red wine. 
Overall, this was easy and not too far from what I've had in restaurants.
I will try this again with modifications.
It was great! Added more garlic, red pepper flakes and Old Bay Seasoning (instead of salt). Also added fresh basil and oregano.
Great as is. No need to modify unless you like it very hott.
I don't use any scallops, just shrimp. I would definitely recommend using San Marzano tomatoes for the sauce. I also just mince and add the garlic. Great recipe!

I didn't have any scallops, so used 1 lb of shrimp. Substituted 29 oz of diced tomatoes. I served it on rotini pasta, but would use a different pasta next time. Also, it was calling out for the pan to be deglazed after cooking the shrimp!
Suggest bigger shrimp or more...good and simple! :-)
Wonderful quick and easy dish to make.
I sauteed some yellow peppers and added them. Delicious!
Simple and delicious! I used two cans of diced tomatoes and one small can of tomato sauce. I added chopped up marinated artichoke hearts.
So delicious! Simple ingredients yet very rich taste. Easy to whip up too! Awesome recipe. Thank you!

I followed other reviewers suggestions to add white wine, less red pepper, and canned tomatoes. I would have preferred it more spicy. I also added a red bell pepper and 2 diced Roma tomatoes after the garlic and before the canned tomatoes. It was delicious!
Made this last night for dinner. It was a hit! Only used 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes and that was a little spicy. Will definitely make this again!!

I was extremely disappointed in this recipe. First, it was in no way "sauce", it was a bunch of chopped up canned tomatoes. Second, a good fra diavolo should have a nice kick to it, which this utterly lacked. I won't be trying this one again...

This is fabulous! It is spicy but that can be easily adjusted. I used linguine the first time, after that rice, it makes it much easier/neater to eat. Have cooked it 3 times in the past few weeks. The sauce is a no brainer to prepare a few days in advance and then cook whatever pasta you choose the night of the meal. Kudos to MARBALET
It was easy to follow but just okay. I won't be making it again.
It was easy to follow but just okay. I won't be making it again.

Really simple and delicious. No need to get fancy with this amazing recipe It is spicy so if you don't like spicy cut back on the red pepper. My boyfriend said he could eat this every night of the week. I can't wait to make it for family and friends.
had on 3/24/2015 just as written, i'll have this again for sure but will cut down the pepper and cut my shrimp in half so more mouthfulls' will have shrimp...

DH declared this "outstanding". I was concerned that there were no "Italian herbs" (basil/oregano). Need not have worried. Red pepper & parsley let the seafood flavors come forward. I used "sea scallops" rather than "bay" as they looked better quality at the fish mongers. We used home grown tomatoes (frozen from last year's harvest) This will be put in the "favorites" list in our recipe log! It was quick, easy,and very, very flavorful!
Delicious stuff! I made a few minor changes. Sauteed the garlic in EVOO-added 2 15 oz. cans diced tomatoes-simmer 15 minutes-add shrimp-simmer another 15 minutes. Done! Also added red pepper flakes.

I'm going to make this for dinner tonight. I'm going to attempt to make homemade pasta too (I've never made it before)!I can't wait to try it. It looks delish...So tomorrow I will post a pic of how it all turned out!
I love your recipe's, but I wish you could add a printer button so only the recipe gets printed and not all the other stuff.
This recipe is great! Just a note to those reducing the crushed red pepper, Fra Diavolo is supposed to be HOT. Does anyone know where to buy the crushed red pepper without the seeds?

First time I made this without scallops cuz they didn't have any at the store and I used zucchini noodles and no red pepper. Tasted great! Second time, used scallops and red pepper with linguini, and it was super yummy. I like spicy, but I will use only 1/2 tsp. of pepper flakes next time, just cuz I want to also experience the other flavors more too. Thank you for the recipe !!!

I made just the sauce portion and served it over roasted sausages and linguine, and added a splash of white wine while it simmered; delicious! I used the full teaspoon of pepper and enjoyed it very much.
This was out of the norm for us, but very good. I wasn't expecting it to be so hot lol

we liked this recipe a lot! we used crushed tomatoes. added pinot to the sauce and used chicken instead of seafood. in addition to fresh grated parmesan cheese we put a few teaspoons of whole milk ricotta cheese on top, viola, excellent!
Added some onion, red wine and basil and served with Parmesan cheese. Hubby and toddler loved it!
This was ok
My husband is a spicy food fanatic and this really suits his taste for spicy. Not TOO much spice that it overwhelms the great flavor of the shrimp.

Made this recipe with a few reviewer suggested additions: Red wine, fresh basil, fresh tomatoes. Superb. Served it on whole wheat pasta with freshly grated Parmesan. My husband LOVED it. He was disappointed to learn there were no second servings this time.
Wow! What a great recipe. Great results!
Only thing I changed was adding some mushrooms and onion. Still pretty good, will have again, Thanks for sharing
Just the right amount of spice
This is a great recipe for a novice chef. It is easy, tastes great as is, and you can modify it to your own unique flavor with experimentation.
This was good. I used precooked jumbo shrimp (it was what I had). Next time, I'll use fresh and a smaller size. Added Penzeys pasta sprinkle toward the end instead of parsley.
Great, but add more shrimp and scallops
It was okay, a bit bland. I added wine and cut down on the red pepper flakes, as others suggested. Still missing something. Maybe add some chopped black olives.....

My husband and I really enjoyed this, made with whole wheat linguini, and Spinach-Strawberry salad from this site and 1/2 loaf of French bread- buttered, sprinkled with garlic salt, a big thick slice of fresh tomato and a thin slice of Havarti- broiled for 4 min on low. There were no left overs of anything

Very quick and easy. Added shrimp and scallops to sauce to cook like others suggested. Used 1 can diced tomatoes and 2 fresh I had, and definitely decreased the red pepper to 1/4 tsp. was perfect and I like hot spicy foods. Will make again.

I love it when simple recipes come together, and this one does! Two suggestions, though. Use San Marzano tomatoes if you can find them, and do not use shrimp, or scallops that have already been cooked. It makes a difference. Thanks, MARBALET!
I have to say this was just so-so for us.

Made this dish for Christmas Eve and it was a huge hit. My Mom and brother are excellent cooks and both raved about this recipe. I used canned Italian plum tomatoes and one can of fire roasted tomatoes, and doubled the shrimp because the bay scallops did not look too fresh at the store. Excellent, will definitely make again. Too bad I forgot to take a pic!

I rate things based on if my family gets up for seconds... and they all did on this one. The only change I made was I doubled the shrimp because I didn't have any scallops. I bet this would be even more amazing with both. I will definitely try again as written.
Made this last night for date night...no leftovers! It was delicious, added broccoli for some extra veggies. Thanks for the great recipe, will definitely make again :)

Delicious and so easy! I've made this many times and it's my go to recipe for shrimp. I love that I have all the ingredients on hand, except the shrimp. Since fresh tomatoes aren't good year round and canned are often cheaper, I use two cans of salt-free diced and one can of fire-roasted diced tomatoes. I cut the red pepper to about 1/4 tsp., add 3 tsp dried oregano, 1/2 cup white wine, and double the shrimp. I love the flavor of the sauce when its cooked down and my husband always comments on how good it tastes. Shrimp dishes can be tricky and this one always comes out right! Thank you for sharing Marbalet!

We loved it! We used this recipe twice first, We added 1/2 of white wine, used fire roasted diced tomatoes and the red pepper flakes, soo good, they we didnt use any red pepper flakes used the wine and diced tomatoes but added feta cheese at the end, soooo good, not spicy at all!
Got rave reviews from my family. Followed the recipe with no modifications. Will make again.
This dish is very easy to make and is very good.

YUMMY! I try to follow recipes as written the first time, then adjust. I didn't have scallops so I used extra shrimp. After the sauce cooked down, I thought I'd like a little more, so I added a couple more cups of fresh tomatoes that I had planned to freeze. We like spicy so both my husband I added a little more crushed pepper, but spiciness is a matter of taste. This will be a recipe I make again. Hubby LOVED it! I am looking forward do making it when I have time to make homemade pasta.

I subbed about 1/2 cup of organic pasta sauce for some of the tomatoes in the sauce and then I added Herb de Provence. After I sauteed the shrimp, I added them to the sauce, which had been simmering for 30 minutes and also added about 1/2 tablespoon of white truffle oil. I also added bok choy and green onion to the sauce originally. It was STUPENDOUS. Husband left no survivors.

I suppose it would be 4.5 only because I did make a few very minor adjustments...and people say how can you rate something accurately if you've altered it. I don't feel my adjustments were major enough although just enhanced just a little for what I know my preferences are...I added maybe 1/4 c of white wine and about 2 tbs of chopped fresh basil to the sauce. I did choose to use a can of crushed tomatoes like many others and had half a can of diced tomatoes left over so added that-I don't see that altering the flavor. I tasted the sauce after it cooked about 30 minutes and loved it! My rating is based off that. I then opted to add maybe 1/4 tsp of sugar to see the difference since some mentioned it. Only because I had a taste for it and to stretch the seafood flavor (couldn't buy scallops but used 3/4 pounds of shrimp) I added a can of minced clams. That took it to 5 stars for me, but bottom line it's a great recipe and if I ever have fresh tomatoes I may try that way :)
I did it without the shrimp and added a couple other spices and it was amazing!

This was very, very good. I would have liked the sauce to be a bit thicker. I used two cans of 28 oz. and lots of shrimp. Next time I'd add some tomato paste. Other than that, I wouldn't change a thing.

Great recipe! I used jumbo shrimp and about 1.5x the amount of seafood. The tomato juice reduced quite a bit, so I added a generous splash of red wine towards the end of the simmer. It was delicious! I'll probably add capers next time.

Easy and delish! I modified it by heating extra cloves of garlic and then added 1 large link of SoyRizo (brown it) + 2 fresh quartered vine tomatoes. Cooked the tomatoes down and added the canned peeled tomatoes plus 1 tablespoon of red pepper flakes (I love a moderate heat on the tongue). Cooked spaghettini and added the fresh parsley and shrimp per the recipe. This resulted in a thick and hearty sauce - stick to your ribs kind of sauce that worked very well with the thin spaghettini (bonus if you get a nice Italian loaf to sop it up with). Pair this with a crisp Vinho Verde or Dry Riesling and you've got yourself a winner! If it was fall or winter I would have served a nice semi-dry, fruit forward red wine.
Thanks for the variation on using shrimp!

This was just OK. I am not sure if it was the brands of ingredients I used or if I cooked the seafood portion too long, but the flavors did not come together like I thought they should. I will try it one more time before I give up on it.

This was simply delicious. I read all of the reviews and made a few changes. I added about 1/2c of finely chopped red onions to the garlic. I also used the diced tomatoes with garlic, basil, and oregano and added red wine to the sauce. Finally, I mixed the sauce with the linguine instead of topping the pasta with the sauce. My family said it was the best dish that I've made in awhile (and I'm a pretty good cook)! This will definitely be in my recipe rotation.
Very quick and easy recipe. Perfect for a weekday dinner. Family enjoyed it. Will make again.

This was very good, especially considering how few ingredients and the ease of preparation. My family doesn't like big chunks of tomatoes so I just dropped the immersion blender into the sauce pan for a few seconds, giving this a bit more interesting texture. I didn't have any scallops but threw in some frozen tiny langostino instead. I had large tail on shrimp so let those sit in some boiling water for a few minutes and tossed them in at the end so they wouldn't get rubbery. I think any seafood would be great. Added the red wine per other reviewers, a tsp or so of sugar and some italian seasoning. This would be a terrific recipe for last minute guests, too, since I keep these ingredients on hand and it really looks and tastes like a lot more effort than it is. All the kids and hubby commented on the great dinner. Thanks for a new go-to recipe!
delish

I guess it's just me? I won't be making this again. The scallops were a rather nasty addition that I found inedible & the dish itself wasn't anything special. Very disappointed as I made this to impress the hubby on a rare visit home (Army)
we double the sauce because the pasta soaks it up. this is one of our favorite recipes of all time. the flavor is addicting!

I also modified this recipe a bit. I sauteed the garlic in oive oil and used 2 teaspoons of crushed red pepper. I could have used 1 or 1 1/2 but it was good anyway. I added a can of San Marzano tomatoes that I pulsed in the cuisinart with garlic and a touch of basil. I didn't use an onion, didn't need it. I added the shrimp to the sauce and added the linguine at the end to toss. Excellant recipe and so easy!!!!!! Thank you!!!!

It was really good, but cooking the scallops and shrimp at the same time led to the shrimp being a bit overcooked. The scallops I had were a bit large through. I followed the recommendations of other users and cut the red pepper in half which was perfect.

I made this with 2-28oz, cans of diced tomatoes. The tomatoes came seasoned with garlic, basil and oregano. I did use fresh parsley and 1/2 of a mined Vidalia onion. Used fresh shrimp and scallops and it was excellent. Using the seasoned tomatoes out of the can made the experience even easier.

Yum! It was scallop season here in Florida so I turned to this recipe to cook up my husband's catch and it did not disappoint. I made the recipe mostly as is but used my stick blender to crush the tomatoes and added a little brandy to deglaze the pan where the onions and garlic were sauteed. Thanks!

Wow I have never gave a review. My family loved loved it. My husband doesn't care for seafood so I just put his in another bowl before adding shrimp/scallops.
 Side note my boys friend was over and ate.. He said he has never sat down as a family to eat beside christmas. He will be eating a lot more. glad he liked it

This was so yummy! Great recepie! My mom and I made it today, and it will become a new weeknight favorite: the seafood can be used frozen and the sauce doesn't need the full 30 minutes. We did increase the garlic to 8 cloves. Wonderful!
Very Tasty. I used a can of whole plum tomatoes that I had partially pureed, and a can of petite chopped tomatoes, also red wine and oregano. Served over pasta with thinly sliced parmesan.
we add a diced jalapeno for a little extra heat

This was awesome! I used can whole tomatoes from Red Gold and I also doubled the sauce recipe. I then also added Mahi that I precooked and cut into chunks (had it this way at Prawnbrokers in Ft. Myers) along with the fresh shrimp and scallops. Added a little extra red pepper and this dish was fantastic!! Can't wait to make it again soon!!
